content: we've agreed that I'm going to allow a saved version of these to be part of an implementation guide
I'm not sure how to set that up....
I know how to parse them - it's the configuration that's not obvious
what do you mean by config? By being part of of an IG why can't they be just as a static asset file that you can download?
I don't know what 'download' means in that context.
I don't know whether to just call them spreadsheets, or whether I should do something different
CSV will lose all of the formatting. Could we make them available as Excel too?

I am not sure what is the goal - embedding tables in html or exposing the Spreadsheets and downloadable resources. for the second keep as excel. for the first - that seems like a lot of work. since they are not simple tables but linked to other tables.
I will process them into resources, just like I do with the old spreadsheets. I guess they are the same thing really. as for CSV.... it wasn't me who chose that format.
